Description: Hand-made pottery bowl, hard pink ware. Half burnished surfaces with clearly visible burnishing streaks, horizontally made inside the pot. The central part of the inside has been left unburnished. It has a flat base, a straight lower body and a slightly rounded upper body. An arrow-like potmark is visible on the base. Two suspending holes are below the rim.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2007 9 Mar-3 Sept, Belgium, Musee Royal de Mariemont, 'Pharaons noirs Sur la Piste des Quarante Jours'
